basics.label: Program Director / Office Manager
basics.summary: Highly personable, tech-savvy Professional with 9 plus years of experience in administrative and customer service roles, including 5 years of non-profit experience

work.name: Company Name 1
work.summary: Serve as director for a not-for-profit corporation tending to the needs of survivors diagnosed with all forms of Gynecological cancers & their caregivers.
highlights: Raising awareness, fundraising, and hosting local lunch and learns and community events.
Implemented a program with third year medical students at U of L & U of K called "Survivors Teaching Students."
Facilitate monthly support group meetings to GYN Cancer Survivors and their Caregivers.
Handle all of the day-to-day operations in keeping a Non-Profit Organization healthy and thriving.
Maintain donor mailing lists and send out thank you letters and fliers for upcoming events.
Create marketing materials and social media postings.
Maintain donor data with use of Sage Fundraising 50 donor software and Virtual Terminal and Merchant Solutions software.

work.name: Company Name 2
work.position: Personal Assistant to Director of Aviation
work.summary: Assisted in all day-to-day needs of the Director.
highlights: Made travel arrangements, organized office space, and hosted meetings for clients to review veneer products.
Assisted in the Interior design and implementation of high-end Private Jets.

work.name: Company Name 4
work.summary: Collaborated with Customer Care / In-Flight Managers to create strategic plans to enhance customer satisfaction. Provided employees with tools to maintain and increase service levels to both internal and external customers. Served as In-Flight Training Instructor.
highlights: Increased employee knowledge by assisting with development and implementation of product-awareness program.
Qualified in Emergency Safety (First Aide, CPR & Automated External Defibrillator), Emergency Procedures, Crew Resource Management, Security, Serving, Customer Service, Aircraft Specifics, I.O.E.

volunteer.organization: The Louisville Science Center, Twinbrook Nursing Home, The Home of the Innocence, Meredith Dunn Day Care Center, Deaf Adult/Youth Community events, Mini Deaf Olympics, The Junior League of Louisville & Ovarian Awareness of Kentucky Advisory Board
highlights: Leadership role: Psi Chi Member: The National Honor Society of Psychology - Secretary/Treasurer
